Government as a Service

The Global Framework for Digital Government Transformation

Getting Started â†’
Read the Manifesto
Explore Framework

Layer 0 - Legal & Policy Foundation

26+ legislative acts, national strategies, and constitutional amendments. Establish digital-first governance with legal authority for transformation.

Layer 1 - Shared Technology Core

National platforms for identity, payments, data exchange, notifications. "Build Once, Use Everywhere" infrastructure enabling all services.

Layer 2 - People & Process Engine

The 40-40-20 operating model. Workforce capability (40%), service management practices (40%), and enabling technology (20%). Where transformation happens.

Layer 3 - Transparent Service Portfolio

TBM-based cost transparency and portfolio management. Know the true cost of every service, enable isolated governance, and optimize investment decisions.

Layer 4 - Unified Citizen Experience

Single front-door to all government. Unified portal, once-only principle, proactive services, and global community for co-design and improvement.

GaaS Service Value System

The dynamic process engine that connects all layers. See how policy becomes platforms, platforms enable services, and services create citizen value.

What is GaaS? â€‹

Government as a Service (GaaS) is a comprehensive, open-source framework for building digital-native governments. It synthesizes proven practices from global leaders (Estonia, Singapore, UAE, Denmark) into an actionable, modular implementation guide.

Five Core Attributes â€‹

  • Contactless: Services available anywhere, anytime, on any device
  • Intelligent: AI-powered anticipatory service delivery
  • Automated: Instant responses without bureaucratic delay
  • Persistent: Lifetime context across all citizen interactions
  • Secure: Privacy and sovereignty as core design principles

The 5-Layer Operating Model â€‹

The framework integrates 5 architectural layers with a dynamic process engine to create a complete operating model:

Architectural Layers (The Structure):

  • Layer 0: Legal & Policy Foundation - Constitutional authority for digital-first governance
  • Layer 1: Shared Technology Core - National platforms ("Build Once, Use Everywhere")
  • Layer 2: People & Process Engine - The 40-40-20 PPT balance where transformation happens
  • Layer 3: Transparent Service Portfolio - TBM-based cost transparency and portfolio management
  • Layer 4: Unified Citizen Experience - Single front-door to all government services

GaaS Service Value System (The Process): The dynamic engine that flows through layers: Mandate â†’ Architect â†’ Build/Acquire â†’ Transition â†’ Deliver & Support

Who Should Use This? â€‹

Newly Forming Governments Start with digital-native infrastructure from day one

Digital Ministers & CTOs Proven architectures and implementation roadmaps

Development Partners World Bank, OECD, ITU - unified framework for programs

Technology Vendors Build GaaS-compliant solutions for global market

Researchers & Academia Evidence-based practices and case studies
